brief_summary.textblock:
In this study the investigators observe the investigation, whether the new method for
      Boost-Irradiation with the Intrabeam Device of Zeiss Germany influences local recurrence,
      acute and late effects of Radiotherapy, overall survival, quality of life and cosmesis.

clinical_study.brief_title: IORT-Boost-Study, Prospective Observational Study for Intraoperative Radiotherapy of the Breast as a Boost

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  women with histologically proven unifocal ductal-invasive or other histology of
             breast-cancer, size of tumor < or = 3.5 cm

          -  written informed consent

          -  ability of compliance

          -  full contra cutal capability

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  missing written informed consent

          -  no compliance

study_pop.textblock: women with breast cancer breast-conserving therapy

keyword: early and late effects of radiation
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Observational Study for Intraoperative Radiotherapy (IORT) of the Breast as a Boost

other_outcome.description: Patients are asked how many cigarettes they smoke.

primary_outcome.description: Recurrence of breast cancer proven by histology
primary_outcome.measure: number of Participants with local recurrence histologically proven

reference.citation: Bartelink H, Horiot JC, Poortmans PM, Struikmans H, Van den Bogaert W, Fourquet A, Jager JJ, Hoogenraad WJ, Oei SB, Wárlám-Rodenhuis CC, Pierart M, Collette L. Impact of a higher radiation dose on local control and survival in breast-conserving therapy of early breast cancer: 10-year results of the randomized boost versus no boost EORTC 22881-10882 trial. J Clin Oncol. 2007 Aug 1;25(22):3259-65. Epub 2007 Jun 18.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: acute effects of Radiotherapy are assessed by Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Effects (CTCAE Version 4.0) and late effects of Radiotherapy are assessed by Late Effects Normal Tissue Subjective Objective Management Analysis (LENT-SOMA)
secondary_outcome.measure: observation of acute and late effects of Radiotherapy

secondary_outcome.description: The number of Patients who died is assessed.

Quality of life is assessed by European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) quality of life questionnaires (QLQ) cancer modul (C30) EORTC-QLQ-C30 version 3.0 and breast cancer modul (BR23) EORTC-QLQ-BR23
Cosmesis is assessed by Photographs and evaluated automatically.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
